intro: Acosta veneris, commonly known as the Venus' acosta, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are often pink or red in color. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks or in dense forests. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its flowers emit a mild fragrance. Due to habitat loss, Acosta veneris is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
